title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Ok so this one has me confused unless the SMC is causing this. Board came in badly liquid damaged replaced many components too this point. Original corrosion definitely around SMC reset IC and SMC as well as many other things. Board has now been ultrasoniced to rule out flux under SMC. PPBUS is 8.18 volts with a U5110 on the board and SMC Reset goes low. When I take it off, PPBUS goes back to 8.58, I get a light on the charger, and I get a quarter spin for the IC missing. So I thought ok bad IC from donor board. I have now tried 5 different ICs and I get the same issue 8.18 with the chip on and 8.58 with chip off. Is the SMC pulling it low with the IC on or do I seriously just have tons of bad SMC reset ICs from donors? Or could this be an internal board issue? I'm completely confused at this point for sure known good DC in board and flat cable and pullup for SMC_RESET_L measures 100K like it should. Any ideas?

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Checked more voltages on pins of U5110? If it doesn't receive power it will pull down Reset of course.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Pins 3 and 6 measure 3 volts. Pin 8 measures .89 volts. I would assume that means an issue with the SMC?

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Why did you not measure pin 1 and 4? Pin 8 should of course have 3V on it. Check if it has low resistance to GND.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Pin one 3.42 volts, pin 4 zero volts as well. Many kilohms to ground on pin 8

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: pin 4 should not be 0V, resistance to GND there.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: 8 million ohms. Also the first time I plugged this in this morning, I somehow got a green light. I then unplugged and plugged back in and got no light.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Also no short on any of the pins of U5110 all measure ok.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message:
This must be a U5110 issue or one of its traces. Pin 4 should always come up to about 2.75V. 

One way to bypass U5110 is to take it off the board. Then power up the board and manually short SMC_RESET to GND. This will give the SMC a known good start. PPBUS should then come up at 8.6V and board should start. Once that works we can worry about U5110 further.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Ok with U5110 off the board and doing what you said it did SMC Reset. PPBUS goes to 8.6 volts, but the board does not turn on. I get cycling on PP5v_S4RS3 and I also get cycling to about 300 millivolts on CPU VCore.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: PPVRTC_G3H is steady. The S4 rails are the rails cycling the S5's are steady. S4 on down to VCore is pulsing. I also want to say this board does not have an LP8550 on the board at the moment as I have them on order. Can that cause this issue? I figured not..

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Also noticed with no U5110, the SMC_RESET_L signal comes high to 3.4, but pin 8 is 150 millivolts and pin 4 is straight zero still.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message:
Board works without LP8550.

SMC is missing AVREF now, just to be sure that is not causing issue connect pin 1 and 8 together where U5110 was and try again.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Just tried still no power obvi getting 3.42 volts to 3v3 AVREF now tho. Still cycling tho. Bad SMC? There was corrosion everywhere on this btw but worst was definitely by SMC and U5110.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: CPU Vcore cycling too? The usual suspects apply, U1950, U6100 and traces/resistors, J6100 and anything else really. Could be crap under SMC still too.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: VCore pulses to 300 milivolts. J6100 was removed first thing U1950 was replaced pin 8 getting 3.42. U6100 area amazingly was clean. I’m going to try a different SMC even tho it’s gonna suck. I think that could be the issue on this one

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Ok so back to this nightmare. I have replace the SMC. Without a reset IC on the board, 8.58 volts on PPBUS, 3.34 volts on SMC_RESET_L. HOWEVER, when I put my probe and measure SMC_RESET_L, the board SMC resets!!!! With an SMC_RESET_L IC on, it automatically pulls SMC_RESET_L to 0 volts. WHAT IS THE DEAL???? I'm so confused lmao

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Ok so there was definitely a broken trace between pin 3 and R5127. Jumped it, but now I get only a green light and the SMC reset signal is still 0 with a chip on the board but 3.3 without a chip. SMC_ONOFF_L is 3.4 volts. Pins 4 6 and 8 are being pulled down/cycling.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: In diode mode: 0.562 on pin 4, 0.567 on pin 6, 0.527 on pin 8 with the chip on the board. Millions of ohms to ground on pins 8 and 4 and 127 kohms on pin 6.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Also with no ISL on the board, I get no green light at all. But I get 3v42.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Now my PPBUS is 16 volts and SMC reset L is 0 lmao. I can fix the 16 volts problem, but I have no idea on this SMC_RESET issue.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Replaced all fets and ISL and still 16 volts lol I'm calling this a rabbit hole. I do wonder what your input is tho on what could be causing the RESET_L issue my guess is there is an internal short near the ISL causing the PPBUS voltage to go crazy and causing the SMC_RESET_L signal to get screwed up. That's my best guess.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Resistance to GND on SMC_RESET?

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Resistance to ground is high many kilohms to ground

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: ISL and FETs should always be replaced together. Bad ISL can pull down SMC_RESET as it is on that line.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: They were all replaced at the same time I had the SMC Reset Issue before PPBUS went high

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Remove R7100 to isolate SMC_RESET from the ISL

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Without R7100, I still get 0 volts on SMC_RESET_L exact same resistance measurements. Would this not have to be internal to the board at this point? Especially since I’ve replace the SMC, U5110, ISL etc? JTAG was removed too so it’s not an issue

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: What is resistance to GND on SMC_RESET?

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Currently getting around 2Kohms

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: If I inject voltage, my power supply doesn’t ramp up at all and nothing gets warm

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: 2K is too low as there is only a 100K pull up. Only thing to do is to remove everything that is on the SMC_RESET line till the 2K goes away.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: Ok will try and see what happens

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: J6100 also? If so then it is indeed in the board and RIP.

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: J6100 has been gone. This board came in pretty nasty so it doesn’t totally surprise me

title: 820-00164 SMC_RESET_L issue.
message: I know this is an old thread, but I am trying to make sense of it. is pin 8 input or output, created by the SMC or u5110? Based on the comment, connect pin 1 to 8 implies pin 8 is output on u5110, Is that correct? If that is the case, would the SMC be pulling it down to .89 volts?
